comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do no edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: date_parse
description: Returns a date by parsing the second argument using the format specified in the first argument.

params.name: datePattern
params.description: The date format. Refer to the https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/14/docs/api/java.base/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html[`DateTimeFormatter` documentation] for the syntax. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: dateString
params.description: Date expression as a string. If `null` or an empty string, the function returns `null`.

params.name: datePattern
params.description: The date format. Refer to the https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/14/docs/api/java.base/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html[`DateTimeFormatter` documentation] for the syntax. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: dateString
params.description: Date expression as a string. If `null` or an empty string, the function returns `null`.

params.name: datePattern
params.description: The date format. Refer to the https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/14/docs/api/java.base/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html[`DateTimeFormatter` documentation] for the syntax. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: dateString
params.description: Date expression as a string. If `null` or an empty string, the function returns `null`.

params.name: datePattern
params.description: The date format. Refer to the https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/14/docs/api/java.base/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html[`DateTimeFormatter` documentation] for the syntax. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: dateString
params.description: Date expression as a string. If `null` or an empty string, the function returns `null`.

examples:
ROW date_string = "2022-05-06"
| EVAL date = DATE_PARSE("yyyy-MM-dd", date_string)
